name: @microfox/youtube-analytics-api
title: YouTube Analytics API
description: A TypeScript SDK for interacting with the YouTube Analytics API. Supports reportsQuery, group management (list, insert, update, delete), and group item management (list, insert, delete).

readme_map.title: YouTube Analytics API
readme_map.description: The full README for the YouTube Analytics API

all_readmes.description: Initializes a new instance of the YouTubeAnalyticsAPISDK.
Retrieves YouTube Analytics data for a given set of parameters.
Lists all groups belonging to the authenticated user.
Lists all items within a specific group.

constructors.name: YouTubeAnalyticsAPISDK
constructors.description: Create a new YouTube Analytics API client through which you can interact with the API

internalKeys.description: The client ID for your OAuth 2.0 credentials.
The client secret for your OAuth 2.0 credentials.
The redirect URI for your OAuth 2.0 credentials.
The access token obtained after completing the OAuth 2.0 flow.
The scopes required by the SDK.

keysInfo.description: The client ID for your OAuth 2.0 credentials.
The client secret for your OAuth 2.0 credentials.
The redirect URI for your OAuth 2.0 credentials.
The access token obtained after completing the OAuth 2.0 flow.
The scopes required by the SDK.

extraInfo:
To use the YouTube Analytics API SDK, follow these steps:

1. Set up a Google Cloud Project:
   - Go to the Google Cloud Console (https://console.cloud.google.com/)
   - Create a new project or select an existing one
   - Enable the YouTube Analytics API for your project

2. Create OAuth 2.0 credentials:
   - In the Google Cloud Console, go to "APIs & Services" > "Credentials"
   - Click "Create Credentials" and select "OAuth client ID"
   - Choose "Web application" as the application type
   - Set the authorized redirect URIs (include your application's callback URL)
   - Note down the Client ID and Client Secret

3. Set up environment variables:
   - GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID: Your OAuth 2.0 client ID
   - GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET: Your OAuth 2.0 client secret
   - GOOGLE_REDIRECT_URI: Your authorized redirect URI

4. Install the SDK:
   ```
   npm install @yourdomain/youtube-analytics-api-sdk
   ```

5. Implement the OAuth 2.0 flow in your application to obtain an access token. You can use the @microfox/google-oauth package for this purpose.

6. Initialize the SDK with the obtained credentials:
   ```typescript
   import { createYoutubeAnalyticsAPISDK } from '@yourdomain/youtube-analytics-api-sdk';

   const sdk = createYoutubeAnalyticsAPISDK({
     clientId: process.env.GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID!,
     clientSecret: process.env.GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET!,
     redirectUri: process.env.GOOGLE_REDIRECT_URI!,
     accessToken: 'YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN',
   });
   ```

7. Use the SDK methods to interact with the YouTube Analytics API.

Important notes:
- Ensure you have the necessary YouTube Analytics API scopes when obtaining the access token.
- The SDK automatically handles token validation and will throw an error if the token is invalid.
- Respect YouTube Analytics API quotas and rate limits to avoid service interruptions.
- Keep your client ID and client secret secure and never expose them in client-side code.
- Regularly refresh your access token using the refresh token obtained during the OAuth flow.

For more detailed information on using the YouTube Analytics API, refer to the official documentation: https://developers.google.com/youtube/analytics
